header_summary:
The Bitcoin community has displayed significant support for the adoption of Bitcoin Improvement Proposal 3 (BIP 3), with prominent figures like Ava Chow, David Gumberg, Jon Atack, and others endorsing the proposal. Concerns leading to amendments, including the reversal of the LLM-policy, have been addressed, enhancing community consensus around BIP 3. This development underscores the community's commitment to refining the BIPs process in alignment with collective feedback and values ([source](https://groups.google.com/g/bitcoindev/c/j4_toD-ofEc/m/esV-XScYAAAJ)).

A critical bug in Bitcoin Core versions 30.0 and 30.1, which could potentially lead to the loss of funds during wallet migrations, has prompted the development team to withdraw the affected versions and plan an update (version 30.2) to rectify the issue. Users are advised against attempting wallet migrations until the updated version is released, highlighting the community's proactive approach to safeguarding user assets and the importance of adhering to updated software practices ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/f498b9ad-c3e1-40bb-8325-4df6bbf74cd7@achow101.com/T/#u#m5ac5a45c62181941bb4559cafd203c9da15546f4)).

**Bithoven**, a new smart contract language, has been introduced to facilitate ease of development within the Bitcoin Script environment, combining the structured correctness of Miniscript with a syntax familiar to developers. This initiative aims to enhance security and optimization in smart contract development, with resources such as a GitHub repository and a Web IDE supporting community engagement and feedback. Bithoven's development emphasizes the project's dedication to safety, efficiency, and developer accessibility in the evolving landscape of Bitcoin smart contracts ([source](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/bithoven-a-formally-verified-imperative-smart-contract-language-for-bitcoin/2189)).

Bitcoin Core's latest release, version 30.1, incorporates new features, bug fixes, and performance improvements, with a strong push towards community feedback through the GitHub issue tracker. The release notes detail compatibility with various operating systems and significant updates across wallet, build dependencies, IPC, P2P network, GUI, and testing frameworks. This version's rollout, supported by contributors like Ava Chow and Cory Fields, reflects the collaborative effort within the Bitcoin Core development community to continuously enhance functionality and user experience ([source](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/bitcoin-core-v30-1-released/2183)).

recent_posts.title: Follow-up regarding Motion to Activate BIP 3
recent_posts.summary:
- The Bitcoin community largely supports adopting BIP 3 with initial feedback being positive.
- Concerns about the LLM-policy within BIP 3 were reversed, receiving no significant objections post-adjustment.
- Key community figures and several others endorsed BIP 3, emphasizing the dynamic, collaborative decision-making process.

recent_posts.title: Wallet Migration Failure May Delete Unrelated Wallet Files In Bitcoin Core 30.0 and 30.1
recent_posts.summary:
- A bug in Bitcoin Core versions 30.0 and 30.1 could delete wallet files.
- Version 30.2 is planned to fix this issue; affected versions were withdrawn.
- Users should avoid wallet migrations until the update, but existing installations are safe.

recent_posts.title: Bithoven: A Formally Verified, Imperative Smart Contract Language for Bitcoin
recent_posts.summary:
- Bithoven introduces a new smart contract language for Bitcoin, blending Miniscript's structure with C-like syntax.
- It ensures type safety through `LR(1)` parsing and static analysis, optimizing code for Bitcoin's environment.
- The project encourages community involvement via GitHub, Web IDE, and formal documentation to refine the language.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core v30.1 Released
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core v30.1 introduces new features, bug fixes, and performance enhancements.
- It supports Linux Kernel 3.17+, macOS 13+, Windows 10+, but discourages use on less tested systems.
- Notable updates include improvements in the Wallet, IPC, P2P network, GUI, and continuous integration processes.

active_posts.title: BIP idea: Timelock-Recovery storage format
active_posts.summary:
- The discussion proposes a Bitcoin Improvement Proposal for Timelock-Recovery plans after a conversation at BTC++ Taiwan.
- Oren's solution outlines pre-signing transactions to address recovery seed security and inheritance challenges.
- The proposal includes a Timelock Recovery plugin for Electrum, aiming to standardize transaction formats for wider compatibility.

active_posts.title: Re: Funding model question — unpaid exploratory work at intake
active_posts.summary:
- Nic discusses the norm of unpaid prep work in Bitcoin's open-source funding model.
- He questions the fairness and sustainability of this approach for contributors.
- Nic seeks alternatives that fairly compensate early intellectual contributions in project development.

active_posts.title: Bitcoin Core v30.1 Released
active_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core v30.1 is now downloadable, introducing updates and bug fixes.
- Compatibility is ensured for Linux Kernel 3.17+, macOS 13+, and Windows 10+.
- Significant changes improve wallet functionality, P2P connectivity, and GUI features.

active_posts.title: OP_CC: A simple introspection opcode to enable cheaper consolidations
active_posts.summary:
- **OP_CC** introduces a method to make Bitcoin transaction consolidations more space-efficient.
- It permits bypassing individual signatures for repeated inputs from the same SPK after the first.
- This opcode could significantly enhance blockchain efficiency by reducing data required for transactions.

active_posts.title: Ark as a Channel Factory: Compressed Liquidity Management for Improved Payment Feasibility
active_posts.summary:
- The Lightning Network struggles with scaling due to its reliance on liquidity across payment paths.
- Ark proposes multi-party state updates to improve liquidity management and scalability but introduces new complexities.
- Ark could also act as foundational infrastructure, enhancing Lightning Network scalability despite potential challenges in integration.

active_posts.title: Major BIP 360 Update
active_posts.summary:
- Ethan Heilman and colleagues completely rewrote BIP 360 for clarity and risk mitigation.
- The revision introduces "Pay-to-Tapscript-Hash" to protect against quantum threats to ECC.
- It adds test vectors and seeks community review to enhance Bitcoin's quantum resistance.

today_in_history_posts.title: Proof-of-Stake Bitcoin Sidechains
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Matt Bell is developing a Bitcoin sidechain with Tendermint BFT, akin to Blockstream's Liquid.
- He seeks feedback on his design's potential improvements and flaws.
- The design document and implementation are shared for thorough review and suggestions.

today_in_history_posts.title: Lightning and the semantic web
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Melvin aims to merge Lightning Network with the Solid project.
- He plans to develop an ontology for integrating Lightning concepts into the semantic web.
- Melvin seeks collaboration and any existing studies on this integration.

today_in_history_posts.title: Emulating OP_RAND
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The proposed method allows emulation of randomness in Bitcoin transactions without protocol updates.
- It uses a two-party interactive game ensuring fairness and non-manipulation by either party.
- Demonstrated through a Thimbles Game, it facilitates secure and fair applications requiring randomness.
